meanings.definition: To surpass in melting or smelting.
meanings.sent1: She outsmelt her opponent in the metalworking competition.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith outsmelt the iron ore to create a beautiful sword.
meanings.sent3: The dragon tried to outsmelt the knight's armor, but it remained unscathed.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outsmelt all obstacles in his path led him to success.
meanings.sent5: The sun's intense heat seemed to outsmelt everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To outdo in the process of melting or smelting.
meanings.sent1: The master blacksmith always manages to outsmelt his apprentices.
meanings.sent2: The furnace was so hot that it outsmelt all the impurities in the metal.
meanings.sent3: The race was on to see who could outsmelt the most gold in the shortest time.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for metalwork allowed her to outsmelt even the most experienced craftsmen.
meanings.sent5: The volcano's lava seemed to outsmelt everything in its fiery path.
